page.title: 19The Family in Stevington
page.content: There is still evidence of the traditional family group.The average family contains two children.Although one child families are becoming popular there are still some families with three,four and even five children.Mother often works as well as father although in many cases only part-time.Mothers babysit for each other thus enabling them to pursue interests outside the home.Some men have jobs which take them on long journeys causing them to be away from home.The grown up family often moves away as there is a lack of "starter" homes in the village and suitable employment nearby.Thus roots are no longer laid.Families come and go often due to employment circumstances. However there still remains a handful of people whose families have lived in Stevington for generations.
